dialogue.text: You know that massive pirate ship we see at the dock every now and then? Looks like we know who’s in charge of that whole thing.
Woah! His costume is awesome! Ahahah, my uncle would love this guy!
So, crazy thing. That isn’t a costume. He’s a fully legitimate pirate, if the huge ship wasn’t already the big giveaway.
Whuh, forreal? Those still exist nowadays?

That’s the thing, they SHOULDN'T. Old fashioned pirates actually existed for a lot longer than you’d expect out in distant parts of the world, though that type of sailor still fell out of fashion eventually.
Salty and his crew are the last legitimate pirates in the whole world. That begs the question of HOW though... and more importantly, WHY?
Nobody produces those kinds of pirate ships anymore, so it beats me how this guy got his own.
Could be a stolen vintage ship from somewhere, but the original owner must've caught on by now with how much of a name Salty's crew has made for themselves.
Are there even places out in the world for a pirate to plunder and steal from?
The more I see of them, the more I think they're just regular sailors who REALLY like the pirate aesthetic. They're probably not the scary pillaging type like in the movies.
It looks so fun, though! The silly outfits, the shanties, and just exploring the ocean!
The authorities here in Enzync probably have their hands full dealing with Salty's antics, pulling up on their docks whenever he pleases.
I KNOW Captain Vinegar from the Coast Guard wouldn’t tolerate a trespasser, though I haven’t seen her or any of her crew active lately.
I’m pretty ok with that. Captain Vinegar is TERRIFYING!
Agreed. Her eyes pierce into your soul…
